steps: Place beef roast in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
Cook on low for 7-9 hours.

bio: Lena Rodriguez is a renowned chef specializing in Mexican cuisine. She was born and raised in Mexico City, where she developed a passion for cooking at a young age. After graduating from culinary school, she worked in some of the top restaurants in Mexico City  own restaurant, Casa de Lena, which has since become a beloved fixture in the local culinary scene.
steps: Wash the broccoli and cut it into florets.
Fill a pot with about 1 inch (2.5 cm) of water and bring it to a boil.
Place a steamer basket inside the pot.
Add the broccoli florets to the steamer basket.
Cover the pot and steam the broccoli for 5-7 minutes, or until it is bright green and tender when pierced with a fork.
Remove the pot from the heat and carefully take the steamer basket out of the pot.
Season the broccoli with salt, if desired.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy!

awards: James Beard Award for Best Chef in the Pacific Northwest (2021)
Best New Restaurant by Bon Appétit (2017)
steps: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions until al dente, then drain and set aside.
While the pasta is cooking, slice the chicken breasts into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken strips and
cook for about 5-6 minutes, until they are browned on both sides and cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside.
Enjoy!

bio: Lena Rodriguez is a renowned chef specializing in Mexican cuisine. She was born and raised in Mexico City, where she developed a passion for cooking at a young age. steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wash and dry the sweet potatoes.
Pierce the sweet potatoes all over with a fork.
Rub each sweet potato with a little bit of olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper, if desired.
Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
Bake the sweet potatoes for 45-60 minutes, depending on their size. They're done
when a fork can easily pierce through the flesh.
Enjoy!

steps: Bring broth to a low boil.
Add curry powder and salt.
Cook lentils for 20 minutes.
Add rice and simmer for 20 minutes.
Enjoy!

steps: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions until al dente, then drain and set aside.
While the pasta is cooking, slice the chicken breasts into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken strips
and cook for about 5-6 minutes, until they are browned on both sides and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside.
Add the butter and minced garlic to the skillet and cook for about 1-2 minutes
Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 can (14 oz/400g) of diced tomatoes, drained
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes from inside.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef or turkey until browned.
Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
Stir in the cooked rice, drained diced tomatoes, and oregano. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers.
Enjoy!

bio: A brief summary of the chef's background, experience, and accomplishments.
steps: Add hot water to yeast in a large bowl and let sit for 15 minutes.
Mix in oil, sugar, salt, and flour and let sit for 1 hour.
Knead the dough and spread onto a pan.
Spread pizza sauce and sprinkle cheese.
Add any optional toppings as you wish.
Bake at 400 deg Fahrenheit for 15 minutes.
Enjoy!

bio: Samantha Lee is a renowned pastry chef with over 15 years of experience in the industry. She graduated from the Culinary Institute of America and honed her skills in various prestigious restaurants before opening her own bakery. Her creations have been author and a sought-after speaker at culinary events around the world.
stapes: Place flour in a shallow dish. Beat eggs in another shallow dish. In a third dish, mix together breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Dredge each chicken breast in flour, shaking off any excess. Dip in egg mixture, then coat in breadcrumb mixture, pressing the crumbs onto the chicken to adhere.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for about 3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Transfer chicken to a baking dish. Pour marinara sauce over chicken, then sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot with pasta or crusty bread.

bio: Samantha Lee is a renowned pastry chef with over 15 years of experience in the industry. She graduated from the Culinary Institute of America and honed her skills in various prestigious restaurants before opening her own bakery. Her creations have been author and a sought-after speaker at culinary events around the world.
cooking_method: In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed.
Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers, zucchini, onion, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes, until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, and red pepper flakes. Pour over vegetables and stir to coat.
Add cooked quinoa to the skillet and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions or cilantro.

bio: Jose Andres is a Michelin-starred chef, humanitarian, and entrepreneur. He has received numerous awards for his innovative cuisine and philanthropic work, including the James Beard Foundation's Outstanding Chef Award in 2011 and the TIME 100 list of the most globe. He has authored several cookbooks and is a frequent guest on TV shows and at culinary events.
ingredients: 1 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper until well coated.
Arrange Brussels sprouts in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned, stirring once halfway through cooking.

steps: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add green beans and toss to coat with garlic oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sauté green beans for 8-10 minutes, or until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally.

Food & Wine Best New Chef (2010)
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Cut off the woody bottom part of the asparagus spears and discard.
With a vegetable peeler, peel off the skin on the bottom 2-3 inches of the spears (this keeps the asparagus from being all.",string.", and if you eat asparagus you know what I mean by that).
Place asparagus on foil-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt.

steps: Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
Add the diced bell peppers, carrots, celery, and minced jalapeño pepper to the pot and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Add the chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the diced tomatoes (including the juice), drained kidney beans, drained black beans, corn, and vegetable broth to the pot and stir to combine.

Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 lb mixed root vegetables (such as carrots, parsnips, and turnips), peeled and chopped
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a large bowl, toss root vegetables with olive oil, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper until well coated.
Arrange vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned, stirring once halfway through cooking.
